result.execSummary:
The defendant Kimberly M Hallio was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

with elements
Criminal Case Settlement

Case called at 10:33 am [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for STC)
[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Kimberly M Hallio in court, in-custody from Milwaukee County, with Attorney Whitney Hagemann. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
On Motion of the State, the Court strikes the repeater enhancer

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, orders JOC entered.

Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 30 days in Jefferson County Jail, with NO Huber/Work-Release privileges; to commence concurrent to any other sentence in being
--1 day credit for time already served given
--costs of $443 reduced to civil judgment
--No DNA Sample ordered as one has previously been provided
Recess: 11:00 am 

NEXT: Atty Hagemann to submit a stipulation if any further credit is found
and Transport the Defendant from the Milwaukee County Criminal Justice Facility on 7-8-2016 at 10:30am for proceedings in Branch 4
to produce for the 7/8/16 hearing
Status conference on July 8, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Case called at 1:46 pm [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Kimberly M Hallio in court with Attorney Whitney Hagemann. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hagemann requests additional STC in 30-45 days. Miss Hallio has another pending matter in Milwaukee County that Miss Happ would like to see handled before this is finalized
No objection from ADA Shock
Upon questioning of the Court, ADA Shock indicates that there are no known bail violations in this matter
Recess: 1:48 pm 

NEXT:  Schedule STC 7/8/16 at 10:30 am - Send notices
State's
Defendant's
State Public Defender Determination of Financial Eligibility - Defendant not eligible.
Status conference on May 27, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on May 4, 2016 at 01:20 pm.
Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

Case called at 1:28 pm [Clerk SH]
[Commissioner Jennifer Weber presiding for BrII]
Defendant Kimberly M Hallio appears in custody, via video, from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Whitney Hagemann. Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court finds the proceedings are sight and sound sufficient

Service of Complaint admitted; DOB & address confirmed accurate; charge & penalties recited; reading waived.
Atty Hagemann informs the Court that an evaluation has not been done for Miss Hallio as she has private counsel, although she is unsure if she will be keeping that counsel on board
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

Court requires a $1000 signature bond, with conditions: 
-No acts or threats of violence towards any person
-No contact with Jermaine Carson
(*Direct or indirect contact prohibitions include but are not limited to phone calls, letters, emails, texts, social media, other electronic means and no one can contact the person on your behalf except an attorney.) 
-No presence at  308 S. Main St. in Lake Mills
Right to Counsel given; waiver of right to counsel warnings given
Court quashes warrant
Recess: 1:35 pm 

NEXT: (1) DA Pre-trial Conference scheduled for 5/4/16 at 1:20 pm - Send notices (2) STC scheduled for 5/27/16 at 1:30 pm - Send notices
Defendant in custody // Duplicate Original Warrant document returned from JCSD

[Reserve Judge Mac Davis presiding for Branch 4]
Case called at 10:25am [mo]
Defendant Kimberly M Hallio not in court.  ADA Monica Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

At the request of the State, the Court issues a probable cause warrant.
recess: 10:26am
